title: Japan makes history with tense, successful moon landing
summary: Japan's SLIM “Moon Sniper” spacecraft made a successful lunar landing Friday, making the country just the fifth to robotically land on the moon.

title: NASA report offers pessimistic take on space-based solar power
summary: Advocates of space-based solar power are criticizing a NASA report that offered a skeptical assessment of that technology’s ability to provide low-cost green energy.

title: NASA study: clean, space-based solar power beaming is possible
summary: With commitment and investment, space-based solar power could become feasible and help reduce the world's carbon emissions.

title: Japan announces successful SLIM lunar landing, fifth country to reach moon’s surface
summary: Japan staked its claim as a national space power on Friday, as its SLIM spacecraft successfully landed on the lunar surface.

title: China’s Landspace conducts first VTVL test for reusable stainless steel rocket
summary: Chinese launch startup Landspace executed a first vertical takeoff, vertical landing with a test article Friday at a launch and recovery site at Jiuquan spaceport.

title: Axiom Mission Carrying First ESA Project Astronaut Launched
summary:
The European Space Agency’s first project astronaut Marcus Wandt has launched aboard an Axiom-sponsored SpaceX Crew Dragon mission on his way to the International Space Station (ISS). Wandt and his three crew members were launched aboard the Crew Dragon Freedom atop a Falcon 9 rocket from the Kennedy Space Center late yesterday. After a successful […]

title: Axiom’s Third Private Astronaut Flight Up and Away
summary: Axiom Space’s third private astronaut flight is underway with the first all-European space crew. Astronauts from the Italian, Turkish and Swedish Air Forces are on their way to the International […]

title: Space investors banking on funding uptick in 2024
summary: Space investments should start picking up in 2024 after plummeting last year, executives discussing the industry’s outlook said Jan. 17, but will likely remain far short of record highs.

title: Shutdown Averted for A Few More Weeks
summary: With no drama, the Senate and House passed another Continuing Resolution this afternoon to keep the government operating for a few more weeks. For the third time since September, House […]

title: SpaceX launches third Axiom mission to ISS
summary: SpaceX launched Axiom Space’s third private astronaut mission Jan. 18, sending a veteran former NASA astronaut and three astronauts from European governments to the International Space Station.
